data.title: About Serica Energy
data.text:
2016

Year-endÂ reserves for Erskine,Â 3.8 million boe net to Serica

2015

Completed Erskine Acquisition

Production over 3,000 boepd net to Serica in H2 2015

2014

Acquisition of interest in Erskine FieldÂ from BP

Drilling of carried wells in Morocco

2013

BG decide not to proceed with Columbus via Lomond project

2012

Farm out of blocks in Morocco & UK

4,180km2Â 3D seismic acquisition in Namibia

2011

Sale of remaining exploration assets in Indonesia

Award of exploration interests in Namibia

2010

Sale of Kambuna interest

2009

Bandon Discovery west of Ireland

First Gas from Kambuna

2008

Kambuna development wells drilled

Columbus Development Plan submitted

2007

Two successful Columbus appraisal wells drilled

Commencement of Kambuna development

2006

Uncommercial SNS gas discovery (Oak)

Discovery of Columbus Field (CNS)

2005

Serica listed on AIM

Kambuna appraisal well success in Indonesia

2004

Serica Energy Corporation formed

Listed on TSX Venture Exchange

Early Years

On 16th May 2019, Serica Energy Chairman Tony Craven Walker presented ‘Fifty Years in the North Sea: A Personal Journey’ to the Scottish Oil Club at the Royal Scots Club in Edinburgh. The talk followed Tony’s career, starting out in the 1960s at BP, and followed his involvement in setting up three British independent oil companies, Charterhouse Petroleum, Monument Oil and Gas and Serica Energy. He reflected on the political backdrop to developments in the oil and gas market over that period, and some of the current developments in the North Sea.

Â To access the presentation please click here

2018

Serica awarded four exploration licences in the UK 30th Licence Round Â

Columbus Field Development Plan approved

Total E&P, BHP and MarubeniÂ agreeÂ to sell theirÂ interests in the Bruce and Keith assets in the UK Northern North Sea to Serica

Serica opens a new office and Centre of Excellence in Aberdeen

Serica strengthens its asset base with the completion of the BKR transaction

2017

BP agrees to sell Bruce/Keith/Rhum assets in the Northern North Sea to Serica

2024

February: Acquisition of 30% non-operated interest in the P2498 and P2170 licences (together, the Greater Buchan Area) from Jersey Oil & Gas

2023

March: Serica acquires Tailwind

February: First production from Gannet GE-04 well

2022

BKR cashflow share increases to 100%

First oil from Evelyn field

Drilled North Eigg well

Completed successful Light Well Intervention Campaign (LWIV) on Bruce subsea wells

2021

Columbus comes on production in November

R3 well recompleted and brought on production in August

2020

Licence P2501 awarded from 1st January 2020 containing North Eigg prospect

32nd UKCS Licensing Round; awardedÂ a new licence covering four UK Northern North Sea blocks

Maiden dividend of 3 pence per share voted in at AGM

Serica publishes its inaugural ESG Report

2019

Major contract awards for Columbus long lead development items

Rig contract signed for Maersk Resilient Heavy Duty Jack Up rig to drill Columbus development well

Participated in drilling fully-carried Rowallan exploration well

Operated the Bruce, Keith and Rhum assets, increasing production and reducing costs and emissions

Increased Erskine reserves to 5.2mmboe due to improved operating efficiency (based on independent CPR 1/1/19)
